qas.question: Which movement took place during the 19th century?
Which physics subject was affected by The Romantic Movement?

context: <a0_0>The Romantic Movement<a0_0/> of the early 19th century reshaped science by opening up new pursuits unexpected in the classical approaches of the Enlightenment. Major breakthroughs came in biology, especially in Darwin's <a1_0>theory of evolution<a1_0/>, as well as physics (<a2_0>electromagnetism<a2_0/>), mathematics (non-Euclidean geometry, group theory) and chemistry (organic chemistry). The decline of Romanticism occurred because a new movement, <a3_0>Positivism<a3_0/>, began to take hold of the ideals of the intellectuals after 1840 and lasted until about <a4_0>1880<a4_0/>.
